channel.title: Trouble Running a 317 Client?
channel.description:
Hey guys, im new to this whole RSPS creation thing so be basic with me :) thx,
Anyways- I downloaded Stupit's blank client to run Allstar-scape v2 but whenever i try to run the client it gives me an error code of this:
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: EGUI at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: EGUI. Program will exit.[/code]
Any help guys?:)

item.title: Trouble Running a 317 Client?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

You’re missing the EGUI class of your client.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble Running a 317 Client?
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

I would consider for you to get a IDE. IDE’s help you very much in RSPS making, and Java all around. Eclipse is the best one. It’s free too so go to their website and download it and make a new project by File<New<New Project then uncheck the first box below(Use default location) then make it you’re source or client folders. Then create it and boom, you’ve got your Source and Client connected to Eclipse which then you can edit and see what and where errors are.

That error says that there’s an exception. Go and learn about the multiple Exceptions you may get in a Java program. And then you will figure out what is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble Running a 317 Client?
item.dc:creator: @Red_Knox Red Knox
item.description:
@Red_Knox wrote:

I believe you’re missing a cache within your client, Not 100% sure though.

Read full topic
